adjectives.description: drabbish (comparative more drabbish, superlative most drabbish)

examples: the fronts of the thighs of Gibberne's white trousers were scorched a drabbish brown

entries.meaning: (archaic) Having the character of a drab or low wench.
examples: instead of the drabbish woman she had expected, Mrs. Hall saw a pale, dark-eyed, ladylike creature, whose personality ruled her attire rather than was ruled by it.
